Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: This award supports the third annual NSF Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) program's Principal Investigator meeting, Gaylord National Hotel, National Harbor, Maryland, October 3-5, 2012. This working meeting enables increased NSF interaction with projects, visibility into progress of the CPS research portfolio, and information exchange and interaction across CPS research projects. The PI meeting also provides an opportunity for interaction among CPS research community and industrial participants, international speakers, and officials from U.S. government agencies.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
Award 1241676

Project Outcomes Report

2012 NSF CPS PI Meeting

11/2/2014

The National Science Foundation’s third Cyber-Physical Systems Principal Investigators’ (CPS PI) Meeting, held October 3-5, 2012 at the Gaylord National Harbor Hotel and Convention Center in National Harbor, Maryland2012, provided a 3-day forum for the CPS community – comprising academia, industry, and Government researchers – to review current developments in CPS foundations, to identify new, emerging applications, and to discuss technology transition of innovative and transformative results to practice. PI awardees were provided an opportunity to interact and share the progress of their CPS research with others in the broader CPS community. The program of the meeting included presentations about projects funded by NSF and other agencies, keynotes, panels, discussion groups, and poster and demonstration sessions. A major goal of this project was to provide comprehensive planning and coordination services to NSF for the execution of this meeting.

 The 2012 CPS PI Meeting brought together nearly 260 participants from academia, Government, and industry. This number included approximately 125 CPS PIs with active awards.

Numerous presentations were given introducing ground breaking research representing a broad range of CPS disciplines. The 2012 PI Meeting covered topics ranging from:  

  • New technologies that have emerged for CPS
  • New challenges in model based design
  • Challenges on autonomy, verification, and distributed decision making
  • PI research talks covering various CPS domains, including transportation, manufacturing, health and medical, Energy, and Education
  • Birds of a Feather sessions (BoFs) on CPS transportation, medical devices, and education

 All public artifacts, including speaker presentations, the meeting program, meeting participants, and meeting organizers have been disseminated to communities of interest via the 2012 NSF CPS PI Meeting public website at http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg12.  This website includes:

  • A home page explaining the mission, goals, and objectives of the group (http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg12)
  • Pages for PI meeting calendars, program, participant guidelines (http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg12/program, http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg12/guidance
  • Files that enable group members to upload documents such as calls for papers; requests for comments, information, or input; background reports and white papers; slide presentations, posters, etc.
  • Web forms to enable PIs to register for the meeting, submit posters and abstracts, and to submit presentations and bios (http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg12/submit-poster; http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg12/registration)
  • The creation, storage, and maintenance of current and past CPS PI mailing lists, program agenda, PI Meeting presentations, and BOF presentations

This public website is supplemented by associated planning artifacts stored on the Program Committee site at http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg12/pc.

The organizing committee for the 2012 CPS PI Meeting:

?    Katie Dey (Vanderbilt University)

?    Frankie King (Vanderbilt University)
